venue.name: Joseph B. Martin Conference Center, Amphitheater

item.description:
For those among us who are technology and medicine geeks - And yes this is FREE to attend.

This international symposium will focus on research and technology development based on non-linear dynamical systems and self-organizing behavior that are beginning to transform the fields of medicine and robotics. It is co-organized by Wyss core faculty members Jim Collins, Ary Goldberger, Donald Ingber, Radhika Nagpal, Conor Walsh, and Robert Wood. This symposium is free but registration is required to attend.

You can register at this website and get more details here - http://wyss.harvard.edu/viewevent/193/
item.name: NOISE & RHYTHM: Harnessing Complexity in Medicine and Robotics
